events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road 609081

events.name: JavaScript & Interactive Apps - hackerschool
events.description:
Venue: NUS School of Computing COM1 02-06 (Seminar Room 1) (Confirmed!)

Web browsers are everywhere, and so is JavaScript, a dynamic programming language that browsers implement. We will be covering the basics of JavaScript and how to use it to control and add complex behaviour to web pages. 

In the process, we'll go through the development of an interactive web application. Remember to bring you own laptops!!

Sign up now for this free workshop at school.nushackers.org!
events.location: NUS School of Computing, 13 Computing Drive, Singapore 117417

events.name: Conversations: Open Wide Wilderness
events.description:
Open Wide Wilderness 
Saturday, 11 February 2017
ArtScience Museum, Expression Gallery, Level 4

Connections between technology and art with nature have become increasingly inextricable. In the reimagining and renegotiation of our relationship with the natural world, new technology is humanised and embraced as an opportunity to unite environments through art for social change.

This edition of Conversations celebrates the launch of the museum’s latest permanent development Into the Wild: An Immersive Virtual Adventure. It brings together technology creatives and sustainability leaders of this project as they envision the interconnectedness of nature, digital technologies, art and humanity, and how this can lead to an onward and upward movement to the future. Speakers include Brian Gothong Tan (Commissioned Artist for Into The Wild), Sunarto (Wildlife Ecologist, World Wide Fund for Nature - Indonesia), Kevin Teng (Executive Director of Sustainability at Marina Bay Sands), moderated by Honor Harger (Executive Director of ArtScience Museum).

Inspiration Gallery 
2pm- 2.15pm  Viewing of commissioned artist Brian Gothong Tan’s film for Into the Wild: An Immersive Virtual Adventure

Expression Gallery
2.15pm-2.25pm  Welcome and Introduction by Honor Harger
Executive Director, ArtScience Museum
2.25pm-2.45pm Brian Gothong Tan 
Artist and Filmmaker 
2.45pm-2.50pm Introduction to Kevin Teng by Honor Harger 
2.50pm-3pm Kevin Teng
Executive Director of Sustainability, Marina Bay Sands
3pm-3.05pm Introduction to Sunarto by Honor Harger 
3.05pm-3.25pm Sunarto 
Wildlife Ecologist, World Wide Fund for Nature- Indonesia 
3.25pm- 3.45pm Q & A
3.45pm End

events.name: Maker Faire Singapore 2017 -Makers Townhall
events.description: This is a meeting for interested makers who wish to take part in Maker Faire Singapore 2017, to share some logistics, plans, chanes to the faire etc. Also included is a site recee. Please feel free to share your ideas for the Faire as well, after the recee. CLick "Going" to indicate your attendance to the townhall
events.location: The Tinkering Studio, 15 Science Centre Rd, Hall E, Singapore 609081
